title: Enable view mode for schematic ports
description: Adds the ability to show schematic ports on hover when view mode is enabled
body:
- **ability to show schematic ports on hover when view mode enabled**
- **wip**

title: Render PCB note layers in correct z-order alongside silkscreen for top/bottom sides
description: Fixes PCB note rendering order by explicitly associating top_notes and bottom_notes with their respective foreground sides, mirroring silkscreen behavior.
body:
This PR fixes PCB note rendering order by explicitly associating top_notes and bottom_notes with their respective foreground sides, mirroring silkscreen behavior.

What changed

Added side-aware note layer resolution (top_notes / bottom_notes) in Drawer

Included note layers in both the render order and “shift to top” logic

Ensures notes render above copper, drills, and board geometry when a side is active

Updated the panel layout example to exercise notes, holes, cutouts, and footprints together

Result
PCB notes now render consistently and predictably with silkscreen on the active side, eliminating missing or incorrectly layered annotations in panel/board views.


https://pcb-viewer-git-fork-abse2001-main-tscircuit.vercel.app/?fixture=%7B%22path%22%3A%22src%2Fexamples%2F2026%2Fpanel-layout-mode-none.tsx%22%7D

title: Fix soldermask and drill layer ordering with explicit soldermask rendering and hover support
description: Fixes PCB rendering issues by making soldermask a first-class layer and correcting drillsilkscreen ordering across the canvas pipeline.
body:
This PR fixes multiple long-standing PCB rendering issues by making soldermask a first-class, explicitly rendered layer and correcting drill/silkscreen ordering across the canvas pipeline.

Core changes:

Upgrades circuit-to-canvas to v0.0.61 to pick up corrected hole/soldermask semantics.

Introduces drawSoldermaskElementsForLayer to explicitly render soldermask per layer instead of relying on side effects.

Fixes drill rendering so holes are drawn first, then properly covered by soldermask (with margins), matching real PCB fabrication behavior.

Corrects layer and z-order sequencing (silkscreen vs soldermask vs drill) in both CanvasPrimitiveRenderer and Drawer.

Propagates drawSoldermask consistently to vias and SMT pads so soldermask behavior is uniform.

Adds hover highlighting for soldermask openings on pads, vias, and plated holes.

Result: accurate soldermask coverage, correct drill visibility, proper silkscreen ordering, and predictable hover behavior across all PCB layers.

https://pcb-viewer-git-fork-abse2001-main-tscircuit.vercel.app/?fixture=%7B%22path%22%3A%22src%2Fexamples%2F2025%2Fsolder-mask-smtpad.fixture.tsx%22%7D


https://pcb-viewer-git-fork-abse2001-main-tscircuit.vercel.app/?fixture=%7B%22path%22%3A%22src%2Fexamples%2F2025%2Fsoldermask-margin-comprehensive.fixture.tsx%22%7D


https://pcb-viewer-git-fork-abse2001-main-tscircuit.vercel.app/?fixture=%7B%22path%22%3A%22src%2Fexamples%2F2026%2Fasymmetric-soldermask-margin.fixture.tsx%22%7D

title: Add pcb_panelization_placement_error schema and include in unions
description: Add a new error type for PCB panelization placement failures, ensuring it is recognized in the type system and tooling.
body:
### Motivation
- Introduce a dedicated error type to represent placement failures that occur during PCB panelization so these events can be validated and carried through the type system and tooling. 
- Ensure the new error is available in the PCB element exports and the global `any_circuit_element` union so parsers and consumers can recognize it.

### Description
- Add `src/pcb/pcb_panelization_placement_error.ts` implementing the Zod schema `pcb_panelization_placement_error`, TypeScript interface `PcbPanelizationPlacementError`, and a deprecated alias `PCBPanelizationPlacementError`.
- Export the new error from `src/pcb/index.ts` and include its type in the `PcbCircuitElement` union.
- Include the new `pcb.pcb_panelization_placement_error` variant in the global `any_circuit_element` union in `src/any_circuit_element.ts`.
- Document the new interface in `docs/PCB_COMPONENT_OVERVIEW.md` and add tests in `tests/pcb_panelization_placement_error.test.ts` that assert parsing and `any_circuit_element` inclusion.

### Testing
- Ran typecheck with `bunx tsc --noEmit`, which completed successfully.
- Ran the new test suite with `bun test tests/pcb_panelization_placement_error.test.ts`, which ran 2 tests and passed (2 pass / 0 fail).
- Ran formatting via `bun run format` as part of cleanup, which completed successfully.

------
[Codex Task](https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_6979625b44d4832eb00c91cb54759e19)

title: chore: bump version to v0.0.365
description: Automated package update

title: Fix Copper Layer Z-Fighting by Enabling Polygon Offset for Copper Text and Copper Pours
description: Fixes z-fighting between copper layers, soldermask, and board surfaces by enabling polygon offset for copper textures, ensuring correct visual stacking.
body:
This PR resolves persistent z-fighting between copper layers, soldermask, and board surfaces by enabling and tuning polygon offset for all copper-related texture meshes (copper pours and copper text). Copper textures now render with consistent depth ordering using a stronger polygon offset, ensuring correct visual stacking on both top and bottom layers. The update also cleans up imports and extends the Copperpour Core Story to include real components on both sides of the board, validating correct copper rendering under realistic conditions.


https://3d-viewer-git-fork-abse2001-main-tscircuit.vercel.app/?path=/story/copperpour-core-test--copperpour-core-test-story

title: Move Copper Pour Rendering Out of JSCAD Geometry and Into Texture Pipeline for Faster, Correct Layered Display
description: Removes copper pour generation from BoardGeomBuilders 3D JSCAD geometry pipeline and re-implements copper pours as dedicated topbottom textures in JscadBoardTextures, improving performance and aligning rendering with traces.
body:
This change removes copper pour generation from BoardGeomBuilder’s 3D JSCAD geometry pipeline and re-implements copper pours as dedicated top/bottom textures in JscadBoardTextures. By disabling copper pours in the geometry builder and rendering them as texture planes instead, we eliminate heavy boolean/extrusion work, improve performance, and align copper pour rendering with how traces are already handled. A new Storybook test (CopperpourCoreTest) validates top and bottom copper pours with solder mask coverage and layer visibility.

https://3d-viewer-git-fork-abse2001-main-tscircuit.vercel.app/?path=/story/copperpour-core-test--copperpour-core-test-story

title: Add Subpanel Component for Hierarchical PCB Panel Organization
description: Adds a new subpanel component enabling nested panel hierarchies within panel elements, supporting recursive nesting for complex manufacturing layouts and comprehensive validation for board containment and positioning.
body:
## Summary
- Introduces new `<subpanel>` component enabling nested panel hierarchies within `<panel>` elements
- Supports recursive nesting (subpanels can contain other subpanels) for complex manufacturing layouts
- Includes full grid layout mode with auto-positioning, tab routing, mouse bites, and customizable edge padding
- Comprehensive validation: board containment checks, position conflict warnings, and placement error reporting
This enables users to organize multiple PCBs into logical groups within a single panel, supporting advanced panelization workflows for production manufacturing.

title: add placement error when there's an underspecified board in a panel
description: Adds an error handling mechanism for multiple boards in a panel without specified pcbXpcbY positions when layoutMode is set to none.

title: Add support for rendering footprints with extruded pads and update related tests
description: This PR adds a new function to render footprints with extruded pads in JSCAD models and updates the test helper to ensure rendered images include these pads.
body: This pull request updates the rendering logic to include extruded pads in the generated JSCAD models for footprints. It introduces a new function to render footprints with pads, updates the test helper to use this new function, and makes minor import reordering for consistency. **Rendering Enhancements:** * Added a new function `getJscadModelForFootprintWithPads` in `lib/vanilla/index.ts` to render both the footprint and its extruded pads by composing `Footprinter3d` and `ExtrudedPads` components. * Updated the test helper `renderFootprint` in `tests/helpers/render-footprint.ts` to use `getJscadModelForFootprintWithPads`, ensuring that rendered images now include extruded pads. **Code Quality Improvements:** * Reordered and grouped imports in `lib/vanilla/index.ts` for improved readability and consistency. * Minor import reordering in `tests/helpers/render-footprint.ts` for consistency. ## Before ## After /fix #234

title: Shift weekly start date to Tuesday 18:30 UTC
description: Shifts the weekly start date calculation to align with Tuesday 18:30 UTC by applying a 5.5-hour offset from the last Wednesday, ensuring consistent UTC documentation and adding a test for early-Wednesday behavior.
body:
Summary
- Derive weekly start from last Wednesday with a 5.5-hour offset to align with Tuesday 18:30 UTC
- Keep last-Wednesday calculation consistent in UTC and document the offset
- Add a test covering early-Wednesday UTC behavior

title: Fix PCB hole rendering order so soldermask correctly covers holes
description: Fixes PCB rendering order to ensure soldermask correctly covers holes, improving visual accuracy in canvas rendering.
body:
This change corrects the PCB render pipeline by moving pcb_hole drawing before the soldermask layer instead of treating holes as final punch-through elements. Holes are now rendered under soldermask, allowing the mask to correctly cover or margin them, while cutouts remain true punch-throughs drawn last.

Key improvements:

Separates holes from cutouts in the draw order to match real PCB fabrication behavior

Ensures soldermask margins are applied consistently to holes

Removes incorrect early-exit logic that skipped holes marked as soldermask-covered

Clarifies and documents the full rendering stack with explicit, ordered steps

Result: visually accurate soldermask coverage and correct hole behavior in canvas rendering.

title: Remove error-prone LightBurn pulse width manual edits by emitting QPulseWidth
description: Replaces all pulseWidth usage with qPulseWidth to match LightBurns QPulseWidth XML field, emits QPulseWidth Value1 in cut settings, and updates XML snapshot and roundtrip tests to validate the new field.
body:
- Replace all pulseWidth usage with qPulseWidth to match LightBurn’s QPulseWidth XML field.  
- Emit <QPulseWidth Value="1"/> in cut settings and parse it back into qPulseWidth.  
- Update XML snapshot and roundtrip tests to validate the new field.

title: Prevent laser cut mistake by mapping pulse width to the correct qPulseWidth field and use 1 ns unit

body:
- Replace the cut-setting field from pulseWidth to qPulseWidth so LBRN receives the correct parameter.
- Keep laser profile defaults and UI in ns, aligning tests and docs with the correct field.
- Bump lbrnts to ^0.0.17 to match the updated schema.
